text: Rudolf Wille (2 November 1937 - 22 January 2017) was a German mathematician. He was professor of General Algebra from 1970 to 2003 at Darmstadt University of Technology. His best known work was the invention of Formal concept analysis. This is a method to find structures in data, based on objects and their shared attributes. It uses mathematical lattice theory. Wille was born in Bremen on 2 November 1937. He died on 22 January 2017 in Bickenbach, Hesse. He was 79. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:German mathematicians Category:People from Bremen (state)
title: Rudolf Wille
